## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax
for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on
using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that
includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code
chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


```{r}
library(spray)
set.seed(0)
desired <- c(1,1,NA,NA,NA)
A <- spray(matrix(c(
  2,3,0,0,0,
  1,1,2,3,2,
  2,3,1,1,1,
  2,3,1,1,3,
  1,1,3,3,3,
  0,0,0,1,0,
  2,3,2,2,2),ncol=5,byrow=TRUE),1:7)
A
pullout(A,c(2,3,NA,NA,NA))
factorize(A,1:2)
```


and a more complicated example:

```{r}
a <- rspray(40,arity=5)
summary(a)
jj <- factorize(a,c(2,3))
total(multiply(jj))==a
```

What I want to do is this:

```{r}
library(partitions)
jj <- listParts(5)  # too long, just print the first 4:
sapply(seq_len(4),function(i){jj[[i]]})
```

And then do something like

```{r}
o <- listParts(5)[[39]]
o
# factorize(a,o) not yet implemented!
```
